alert.note: Alert for Huntington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 5:40PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Huntington, Wells and western Adams Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a few strong thunderstorms 7 miles north of Montpelier, or 8 miles southwest of Bluffton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Nusiance flooding may accompany these storms. The strong thunderstorms will be near... Bluffton around 545 PM EDT. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 275 and 290. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
